article.name: Prevent - The Shield Icon Has Disappeared from Microsoft Outlook
article.title: Prevent - The Shield Icon Has Disappeared from Microsoft Outlook
article.body:
You may occasionally get reports that the Prevent shield icon has disappeared from a user's Microsoft Outlook. There are multiple potential causes for this problem. This article will walk you through the most common issues behind the missing Prevent shield icon and how to resolve them.

Simplified Ribbon

The most common cause of the Prevent shield icon disappearing is the Simplified Ribbon view, which reduces the number of icons visible on the toolbar. This issue can occur if the user has either manually selected this option or if a Microsoft Outlook update has automatically switched to this view.

To restore the Prevent shield icon in this case:

  1. Open a new email window in Microsoft Outlook.
  2. Navigate to the far-right side of the toolbar and select the downward arrow icon.
  3. From the drop-down menu, select Classic Ribbon.

This option will restore the ribbon to its original, more detailed view, allowing the full array of icons, including the Prevent shield icon, to be displayed.

Multiple Outlook Add-Ins

If a user has multiple Microsoft Outlook add-ins, one of them may have taken precedence over the Prevent shield icon in the ribbon.

To resolve this issue, follow the steps below:

  1. In Microsoft Outlook, navigate to File Options Add-ins.
  2. Disable or reorder the add-ins to ensure the Prevent shield icon is given priority.
  3. Restart Microsoft Outlook to apply the changes.

These steps will ensure that the Prevent shield icon remains visible on the ribbon.

images.alt:
The image displays a user interface (UI) context menu for configuring the Ribbon interface within a host application environment (likely a productivity suite).

**UI Elements and Context:**

*   **Menu Title:** The menu is an overlay situated near the top border of the application window, obscuring part of the standard title bar controls.
*   **Sections and Headers:** The menu is divided into two distinct configuration sections separated by a horizontal rule.
    1.  **Ribbon Layout:** Contains options for the visual style of the ribbon.
    2.  **Show Ribbon:** Contains options governing the visibility and display behavior of the ribbon.

**Text and State Details:**

| Section | Menu Item | State/Glyph | Contextual Detail |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Header** | Ribbon Layout | N/A | Section header. |
| Layout | Classic Ribbon | Hover/Focus | A cursor (hand pointer) is positioned over this item. |
| Layout | Simplified Ribbon | Checked (✓) | This is the currently active/selected layout. |
| **Header** | Show Ribbon | N/A | Section header. |
| Visibility | Full-screen mode | Default | Standard display option. |
| Visibility | Show tabs only | Default | Standard display option. |
| Visibility | Always show Ribbon | Checked (✓) | This is the currently active display setting. |
| Visibility | Hide Quick Access Toolbar | Default | Option controlling the QAT visibility. |

**Background Context:**

The background application shows standard Windows application controls (Minimize, Maximize/Restore, Close) and a partially visible functional area including navigation elements and a security classification indicator labeled "**No Label**" with an associated lock/shield icon.
